subject: linear_algebra
title: Matrix Transpose
contentHtml:
The matrix transpose operation is a fundamental concept in linear algebra.

Given an m×n matrix A, its transpose, denoted by AT, is obtained by swapping the rows and columns:

\(\mathbf{A}^{\mathrm{T}} = \begin{bmatrix}\mathbf{a}_{1} & \cdots & \mathbf{a}_{n}\end{bmatrix}^{\mathrm{T}} = \begin{bmatrix}\mathbf{a}_{1}^{\mathrm{T}} \\ \vdots \\ \mathbf{a}_{m}^{\mathrm{T}}\end{bmatrix}\)

This operation preserves the matrix product, i.e., for any matrices A and B:

\(\mathbf{A}^{\mathrm{T}} \mathbf{B} = (\mathbf{AB})^{\mathrm{T}}\),

The matrix transpose operation is a fundamental concept in linear algebra.

Given a matrix A, its transpose AT is obtained by swapping its rows with columns.
intuition: The transpose operation is useful when working with matrices that represent linear transformations between spaces.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, the transpose of a weight matrix is used in backpropagation to compute gradients.
